items.title: ImportError in app frozen by py2exe
items.body:
When App frozen by py2exe is run, below error occurred.
Win 8.1 64bit, python 2.7.13 win32, jaraco.classes 1.4.3, py2exe 0.6.10a1
```
D:\test\dist>cqpocrdistsvr.exe
----------------------------------------
main : Unhandled error
Traceback (most recent call last):
  ...
  File "zipextimporter.pyo", line 74, in load_module
  File "cherrypy\__init__.pyo", line 66, in <module>
  File "zipextimporter.pyo", line 74, in load_module
  File "cherrypy\_cperror.pyo", line 128, in <module>
ImportError: No module named jaraco.classes.properties
```

This error is similar to [https://github.com/jaraco/jaraco.classes/issues/2](https://github.com/jaraco/jaraco.classes/issues/2)
if empty `__init__.py` is created in `jaraco` folder, my frozen app works well.

When `jaraco`, `jaraco.classes` or `jaraco.classes.properties` is added to `includes` or `packages` in setup.py for py2exe,
below error occurred.
```
D:\test>python setup_py2exe.py py2exe -c
running py2exe
...
*** searching for required modules ***
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup_py2exe.py", line 112, in <module>
    ctypes_com_server=[]
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\distutils\core.py", line 151, in setup
    dist.run_commands()
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\distutils\dist.py", line 953, in run_commands
    self.run_command(cmd)
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\distutils\dist.py", line 972, in run_command
    cmd_obj.run()
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\site-packages\py2exe\build_exe.py", line 241, in run
    self._run()
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\site-packages\py2exe\build_exe.py", line 294, in _run
    self.find_needed_modules(mf, required_files, required_modules)
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\site-packages\py2exe\build_exe.py", line 1306, in find_needed_modules
    mf.import_hook(f)
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\site-packages\py2exe\mf.py", line 719, in import_hook
    return Base.import_hook(self,name,caller,fromlist,level)
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\site-packages\py2exe\mf.py", line 136, in import_hook
    q, tail = self.find_head_package(parent, name)
  File "C:\devtool\py27x86\lib\site-packages\py2exe\mf.py", line 204, in find_head_package
    raise ImportError, "No module named " + qname
ImportError: No module named jaraco
```

items.title: pip install missing `__init__.py` in `jaraco` module?
items.body:
Not sure what happened but recently we've ran into a bug with this module, behind CherryPy.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/runpy.py", line 162, in _run_module_as_main
"__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
exec code in run_globals
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/__main__.py", line 18, in <module>
main()
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/__main__.py", line 14, in main
_main()
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bin/celery.py", line 326, in main
cmd.execute_from_commandline(argv)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bin/celery.py", line 488, in execute_from_commandline
super(CeleryCommand, self).execute_from_commandline(argv)))
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bin/base.py", line 279, in execute_from_commandline
argv = self.setup_app_from_commandline(argv)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bin/base.py", line 481, in setup_app_from_commandline
self.app = self.find_app(app)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bin/base.py", line 503, in find_app
return find_app(app, symbol_by_name=self.symbol_by_name)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/app/utils.py", line 355, in find_app
sym = symbol_by_name(app, imp=imp)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bin/base.py", line 506, in symbol_by_name
return imports.symbol_by_name(name, imp=imp)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/kombu/utils/imports.py", line 56, in symbol_by_name
module = imp(module_name, package=package, **kwargs)
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/celery/utils/imports.py", line 101, in import_from_cwd
return imp(module, package=package)
File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module
__import__(name)
File "cart/__init__.py", line 10, in <module>
import cherrypy
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/cherrypy/__init__.py", line 66, in <module>
from ._cperror import (
File "/opt/cartd/virtualenv/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/cherrypy/_cperror.py", line 128, in <module>
from jaraco.classes.properties import classproperty
ImportError: No module named jaraco.classes.properties
```
This interaction is with cherrypy and celery somehow. The cherrypy isn't getting called to start anything it's just getting imported. I did notice that the `jaraco` module is just an empty directory, this traceback gets resolved when I touch `__init__.py` in the `jaraco` directory. I thought that makes a proper python module out of the directory which is why the stack dump is happening.

This is getting invoked by importing cherrypy when starting celery, though not executing anything internal to cherrypy.

So I guess the bug is why is `__init__.py` not in the jaraco directory for this package when downloaded using pip?

items.title: Add project description
items.body: I'm going to add this package to Buildroot repository as a part of CherrPy dependencies and I need a proper package description. Thanks
